poem:
### Progress

Beneath the wheel's roar  
the silent fields ache,  
hedgerows whisper their sorrow  
to the indifferent wind. 

Bright asphalt binds us,  
a road to nowhere,  
while nature, dispossessed,  
recedes into a memory. 

We pave our future  
with the bones of the past,  
unheeding, unseeing,  
adrift in a metal dream.
